activities: TrustPoint International is a leading electronic discovery and document review management company.  Its core focus is providing law firms and their clients with managed review solutions using contract attorneys and project managers to assist with document review projects in litigation, investigations and merger-related inquiries.  As such, the Company receives personal information from clients or law firms from or related to the EU.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Employment related data and human resource data received and distributed online, offline and electronically processed information.
recoursemech: TrustPoint elects to satisfy the requirement of the Safe Harbor Enforcement Principle by committing to cooperate with the Data Protection Authorities (DPA).  Will cooperate with the DPAs in the investigation and resolution of complaints brought under the Safe Harbor.  TrustPoint will work with the individuals first and foremost unless we find the complaint to be frivolous.  It will comply with any advice given by the DPAs where the DPAs take the view that TrustPoint needs to take a specific action to comply with the Safe Harbor Principles, including remedial or compensatory measure for the benefit of individuals affected by any non-compliance with the Principles.  Further, TrustPoint will provide the DPAs with written confirmation that such action has been taken.
